title: 105_hr4539
content: The "Consular Review Act of 1998" establishes a Board of Visa Appeals under the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Secretary of State shall establish a Board of Visa Appeals composed of 5 members, with no more than 2 being consular officers. The Board has authority to review discretionary decisions of consular officers regarding immigrant and nonimmigrant visas, petitions, and waiver applications for inadmissibility. The Board of Visa Appeals reviews consular officers' decisions on visa applications and waiver requests. The Board can overrule or remand decisions if they are contrary to the evidence. Proceedings follow regulations set by the Secretary of State. The Board of Visa Appeals follows regulations set by the Secretary of State for proceedings, including providing notice of review process, access to written records, and the necessary steps for requesting review. The Board of Visa Appeals ensures access to written records and provides notice of review process, including steps for requesting review and appellant representation. The Board of Visa Appeals requires the appellant to forward the record of proceeding within 30 days, provides notice of the time and place of the proceedings, allows appellant representation by chosen counsel, and requires a written request for review within 60 days of notice of denial. Interested parties for review include the petitioner or beneficiary of an immigrant visa. The Board of Visa Appeals allows interested parties to request a review of decisions within 60 days of denial, including petitioners of immigrant and nonimmigrant visa petitions, postsecondary educational institutions, and recognized international agencies.
